DOCNAME: CASE OF BAKAY AND OTHERS v. UKRAINE
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Violation of Art. 13;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The first and fifth applicants were born in DATE . The second applicant was born in DATE . The third applicant was born in DATE . The fourth applicant was born in DATE . The sixth applicant was born in DATE . The applicants are nationals of GPE and reside in GPE , LOC .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicants initiated proceedings in ORG ( the “ ORG ” ) against ORG of ORG ( the “ Department ” ) , seeking to recover an additional salary payment allegedly due to them for their time - in - service .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE ORG allowed the applicants ' claims and ordered the ORG to pay the applicants the additional salary ( time - in - service bonuses ) . In particular , it ordered that the first applicant be paid ORG CARDINAL in compensation , DATE CARDINAL.CARDINAL , DATE CARDINAL , DATE , DATE CARDINAL.CARDINAL , and DATE UAH CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG service ( the “ Bailiffs ” ) initiated enforcement proceedings for the judgment of CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG suspended the execution of the judgment for DATE due to the lack of funds in the budget of the ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Bailiffs informed the applicants that ORG had suspended the execution of the judgment of CARDINAL DATE . On DATE the Bailiffs informed the applicants that the judgment of CARDINAL DATE would be executed when the ORG had provided the necessary budgetary funding . The judgment remained unenforced due to the ORG 's lack of funds .

CARDINAL . On DATE the amounts due to them pursuant to the judgment of CARDINAL DATE were transferred to the applicants . They received the following amounts ( the initial sums awarded by that judgment having been subjected to taxation ) : the first applicant – UAH CARDINAL.CARDINAL , the second applicant – UAH CARDINAL , the third applicant – UAH MONEY , the fourth applicant – UAH CARDINAL.CARDINAL , the fifth applicant – UAH MONEY , and the sixth applicant – UAH CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . NORP The relevant domestic law is set out in the judgment of DATE in the case of ORG v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL ) .
